item.title: 特朗普加征关税，中国总理与欧盟首脑强调合作
item.description: 中国国务院总理李强和欧盟轮值主席国欧盟委员会主席乌尔苏拉-冯德莱恩在纽约会晤期间强调了合作，这两个世界第二和第三大经济体在受到美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税挤压之际，寻求化解贸易紧张局势。【原文：China's Premier Li Qiang and European Union chief Ursula von der Leyen stressed cooperation during their meeting in New York, as the world's No.2 and No.3 economies looked to defuse trade tensions while squeezed by U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs.】

item.title: 柏肯耐克上调 2025 财年收入预期
item.description: 德国凉鞋制造商 Birkenstock 周四预计，由于对其木屐和鞋的需求强劲，2025 财年的收入将至少达到 20.9 亿欧元（24.5 亿美元），高于此前的预期。【原文：German sandal maker Birkenstock on Thursday forecast fiscal 2025 revenue of at least 2.09 billion euros ($2.45 billion) on strong demand for its clogs and shoes, ahead of its prior guidance.】

item.title: WeTravel 融资 9,200 万美元，扩大人工智能功能
item.description: WeTravel公司的在线平台和人工智能工具简化了酒店预订、航班预订和支付处理等旅游组织流程，该公司表示已在新一轮融资中筹集了9200万美元，本轮融资由蓝宝石风投（Sapphire Ventures）领投。【原文：WeTravel, whose online platform and AI tools streamline travel organisation, such as hotel reservations, flight bookings and payment processing, said it had raised $92 million in a new funding round led by Sapphire Ventures.】

item.title: 全球投资者被美国的惊人反弹吓了一跳，纷纷跳回投资领域
item.description: 随着大资金经理们乘着人工智能和降息的热潮进入年末，投资者纷纷撤离美国，转而投向欧洲和亚洲，暂时放弃了 "世界其他地区 "的交易。【原文：An investor stampede out of the United States and into Europe and Asia has reversed course as big money managers ride a wave of AI and interest rate-cut euphoria into the year-end, ditching the "rest-of-the world" trade for now.】

item.title: 欧洲大型银行成立公司推出欧元稳定币
item.description: 由荷兰国际集团（ING）和意大利联合信贷银行（UniCredit）等九家欧洲银行组成的财团周四宣布，他们正在组建一家新公司，以推出一种以欧元计价的稳定币。【原文：A consortium of nine European banks - include ING and UniCredit - announced on Thursday that they are forming a new company to launch a euro-denominated stablecoin.】

item.title: 新日铁与华盛顿在美国钢铁公司黄金股份授权问题上差距不大
item.description: 日本钢铁制造商新日铁总裁周四表示，新日铁与美国政府在收购美国钢铁公司的黄金股份授权问题上存在微小分歧。【原文：There is a small gap between Nippon Steel and the U.S. government over the authority of a golden share tied to its acquisition of U.S. Steel, the Japanese steelmaker's president said on Thursday.】

item.title: 英国合作社称网络攻击导致其损失 1.08 亿美元
item.description: 英国合作社集团（Co-op Group）周四表示，4 月份的一次网络攻击造成的混乱使其上半年的营业利润减少了 8000 万英镑（1.08 亿美元），拖累公司出现亏损。【原文：Britain's Co-op Group said on Thursday disruption caused by a cyberattack in April cost it 80 million pounds ($108 million) of operating profit in its first half, dragging it to a loss.】

item.title: 时尚集团 H&M 第三季度利润增幅超预期，但警告将面临关税成本问题
item.description: 瑞典时装零售商 H&M 周四公布的第三季度营业利润增幅高于预期，但表示预计 9 月份本币销售额将持平。【原文：Swedish fashion retailer H&M reported on Thursday a bigger-than-expected rise in third-quarter operating profit, but said it expected local-currency sales to be flat in September.】

item.title: 丹麦 "新城 "屏住呼吸，韦戈维热逐渐消退
item.description: 在丹麦海滨城市卡伦堡（又称 "诺和城"），治疗师海蒂-特隆-鲁恩（Heidi Thron Rune）学会了忍受建筑施工的噪音，因为新的设施正在成形，以满足诺和诺德公司（Novo Nordisk）Wegovy减肥药的需求。【原文：In Denmark's seaside town of Kalundborg, also known as "Novo Town", therapist Heidi Thron Rune has learnt to live with the noise of building work as new facilities take shape to meet demand for Novo Nordisk's Wegovy weight-loss drug.】

item.title: 新加坡威胁对在 Facebook 上冒名行骗的 Meta 公司处以罚款
item.description: 新加坡政府周四表示，已要求 Meta Platforms 在本月底之前引入包括面部识别在内的措施，以帮助遏制 Facebook 上的冒名诈骗。【原文：The Singapore government said on Thursday it has given Meta Platforms until the end of this month to introduce measures including facial recognition to help curb impersonation scams on Facebook.】

item.title: ChatGPT，我该买什么股票？人工智能推动机器人顾问市场蓬勃发展
item.description: 随着 ChatGPT 三周岁生日的临近，每 10 个散户投资者中至少就有一个在使用聊天机器人选股，这推动了机器人顾问市场的繁荣，但即使是它的粉丝也说这是一种高风险策略，还不能取代传统顾问。【原文：As ChatGPT nears its third birthday, at least one in 10 retail investors is using a chatbot to pick stocks, fuelling a boom in the robo-advisory market, but even fans say it is a high-risk strategy that cannot replace traditional advisors just yet.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，Irenic Capital 正着手拉拢 Upper Crust 所有者 SSP 的收购意向
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周四报道，激进对冲基金 Irenic Capital Management 在增持了 Upper Crust 所有者 SSP 集团的股份后，正试图为该公司的私有化交易煽风点火。【原文：Activist hedge fund Irenic Capital Management is trying to drum up interest in a take-private deal for Upper Crust owner SSP Group after boosting its stake in the food-to-go operator, the Financial Times reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 早间竞价股市喘口气
item.description: Stella Qiu 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Stella Qiu】

item.title: 伍德赛德公司与日本水苏能源公司和日本电力公司合作开发液氢供应链
item.description: 澳大利亚石油和天然气生产商伍德赛德能源公司（Woodside Energy）周四表示，该公司正与日本水苏能源公司（JSE）和公用事业公司关西电力公司（KEPCO）合作，在两国之间开发液态氢供应链。【原文：Australian oil and gas producer Woodside Energy is teaming up with Japan Suiso Energy (JSE) and utility firm Kansai Electric Power Co (KEPCO) to develop a liquid hydrogen supply chain between the two countries, the companies said on Thursday.】

item.title: 比亚迪在欧盟的销量连续第二个月超过特斯拉，Stellantis 的销量恢复增长
item.description: 欧洲汽车游说组织 ACEA 周四提供的数据显示，中国电动汽车制造商比亚迪上个月在欧盟的新车销量是 2024 年 8 月的三倍，连续第二个月超过美国竞争对手特斯拉。【原文：Chinese EV maker BYD sold three times as many new cars in the European Union last month than in August 2024, surpassing U.S. competitor Tesla for the second consecutive month, data from the European auto lobby ACEA showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 格拉斯贝格矿中断后高盛下调铜供应预期
item.description: 世界第二大铜矿--印度尼西亚格拉斯贝格铜矿（Grasberg）发生事故后，高盛（Goldman Sachs）周四下调了 2025 年和 2026 年全球铜矿供应预测。【原文：Goldman Sachs lowered on Thursday its global copper mine supply forecast for 2025 and 2026 following a disruption at Indonesia's Grasberg, the world's second-largest copper mine.】

item.title: 苹果公司敦促欧盟监管机构仔细研究技术规则
item.description: 苹果公司周三表示，该公司已敦促欧盟监管机构密切关注《数字市场法案》（DMA）对使用苹果产品的欧盟公民的影响。【原文：Apple has urged European Union regulators to take a closer look at how the Digital Markets Act (DMA) is affecting EU citizens who use Apple products, the company said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 消息人士称，中国闪存制造商 YMTC 计划进军 DRAM 市场
item.description: 三位知情人士透露，中国顶级闪存芯片制造商扬子江存储科技股份有限公司（YMTC）正计划扩大 DRAM 芯片的生产规模，包括用于制造人工智能芯片组的先进版本。【原文：China's top flash memory chipmaker Yangtze Memory Technologies Co (YMTC) is planning to expand into manufacturing DRAM chips including advanced versions that are used to make artificial intelligence chipsets, three people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 亚洲股市暂停反弹，日元兑交叉盘走势艰难
item.description: 周四，随着投资者为月末和季末资金流动做准备，亚洲股市从近期的涨势中稍作喘息，而日元兑欧元和飙升的瑞士法郎则测试了新低。【原文：Asian shares took a breather from their recent rally on Thursday as investors positioned for month- and quarter-end flows, while the Japanese yen tested fresh lows against the euro and a surging Swiss franc.】

item.title: 澳大利亚青少年社交媒体禁令在联合国受到好评
item.description: 澳大利亚总理安东尼-阿尔巴内塞在纽约举行的一次活动上宣传了澳大利亚政府全球首创的青少年社交媒体禁令，并警告说社交媒体给儿童带来的挑战是 "不断变化的"。【原文：Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese promoted his government's world-first teen social media ban at an event in New York, warning the challenges posed by social media for children was "constantly evolving".】

item.title: 澳大利亚 8 月季度职位空缺下降，私营部门领跌
item.description: 澳大利亚 8 月份的职位空缺在私营部门的带动下有所回落，而每个职位空缺的失业人数则有所上升，表明劳动力市场略有松动。【原文：Job vacancies in Australia fell back in the August quarter, led by a drop in the private sector, while the number of unemployed per opening edged higher, pointing to a slight loosening of the labour market.】

item.title: 8 月份日本企业服务通胀率上升
item.description: 周四的数据显示，8月份日本服务业通胀率的领先指标有所上升，支持了日本央行的观点，即劳动力成本的上升将有助于把通胀率持续维持在2%的目标附近。【原文：A leading indicator of Japan's service-sector inflation perked up in August, data showed on Thursday, backing up the central bank's view that rising labour costs will help keep inflation sustainably around its 2% target.】

item.title: 美元保持强势，美联储降息赌注摇摆不定，数据成为焦点
item.description: 美元周四持稳，守住了隔夜的涨幅，因为交易员们在等待可能概述关税影响的数据的同时，也在权衡美联储在政策制定者的谨慎基调下推出有节制的宽松周期的前景。【原文：The U.S. dollar was steady on Thursday, holding its overnight gains, as traders weighed the prospect of a measured Fed easing cycle in the wake of a cautious tone from policymakers while awaiting data that may outline the impact of tariffs.】

item.title: 中国奇瑞汽车股价将在香港上市交易中上涨 11.2
item.description: 中国汽车制造商奇瑞汽车首次公开募股（IPO）耗资 12 亿美元，将于本周四开始在香港证券交易所交易，届时奇瑞汽车股价将上涨 11.2%。【原文：Shares of Chinese car maker Chery Automobile are set to rise 11.2% as the company starts trading on Thursday on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange following its $1.2 billion initial public offering (IPO).】

item.title: 台积电、芯片设计软件公司利用人工智能帮助芯片降低能耗
item.description: 为人工智能提供动力的计算芯片需要消耗大量电力。本周三，全球最大的芯片制造商展示了一项新战略，以提高芯片的能效：使用人工智能驱动的软件来设计它们。【原文：The computing chips that power artificial intelligence consume a lot of electricity. On Wednesday, the world's biggest manufacturer of those chips showed off a new strategy to make them more energy efficient: Using AI-powered software to design them.】

item.title: 油价下跌，投资者在七周高点后获利了结
item.description: 美国每周原油库存意外下降，以及担心乌克兰对俄罗斯能源基础设施的袭击可能中断供应，油价在上一交易日跳升至七周高点后出现回落，投资者纷纷获利了结。【原文：Oil prices edged down as investors booked profits after a jump to a seven-week high during the prior session on a surprise drop in U.S. weekly crude inventories and concerns Ukraine’s attacks on Russia's energy infrastructure could disrupt supplies.】

item.title: 阿根廷重新对谷物和副产品征收出口税
item.description: 阿根廷 ARCA 财政机构周三在社交媒体上发文称，在达到 70 亿美元的销售上限后，阿根廷重新对谷物及其副产品以及牛肉和家禽征收暂时中止的出口税。【原文：Argentina has reapplied temporarily suspended export taxes on grains and their by-products, as well as beef and poultry, after reaching a sales cap of $7 billion, Argentina's ARCA fiscal agency said on Wednesday in a post on social media.】

item.title: 梅赛德斯-奔驰集团将持有重庆千里科技 3% 的股份
item.description: 重庆千里科技周四表示，其主要股东已同意将公司 3% 的股份转让给梅赛德斯-奔驰集团，价值 13.4 亿元（1.879 亿美元）。【原文：Chongqing Qianli Technology said on Thursday its key shareholder has agreed to transfer a 3% company stake, valued at 1.34 billion yuan ($187.90 million), to Mercedes-Benz Group .】

item.title: 高通公司展示新 PC 芯片，功能主要面向企业市场
item.description: 高通公司（Qualcomm）周三发布了一套用于个人电脑和手机的新芯片，其中包括一款为企业提供新安全功能的个人电脑芯片，分析师称这很可能是首款此类芯片。【原文：Qualcomm on Wednesday announced a suite of new chips for PCs and phones, including a PC chip with a new security feature for businesses that analysts say is likely the first of its kind.】

item.title: 肯尼亚希望年底与美国达成贸易协议，寻求将《非洲增长和机会法》延长五年
item.description: 肯尼亚总统威廉-鲁托（William Ruto）周三表示，肯尼亚有望在年底前与美国签署贸易协议，他将推动华盛顿将与非洲的免税协议延长至少五年。【原文：Kenya's President William Ruto said on Wednesday his country expects to sign a trade deal with the United States by year-end and that he will be pushing Washington to extend its duty-free agreement with Africa for at least five years.】
